body: # Tourmaline [![Chat on Telegram](https://patrolavia.github.io/telegram-badge/chat.png)](https://t.me/protoncr) Telegram Bot API framework written in Crystal. Based heavily off of [Telegraf](http://telegraf.js.org) this Crystal implementation allows your Telegram bot to be written in a language that's both beautiful and fast. Benchmarks coming soon. If you want to extend your bot by using NLP, see my other library [Cadmium](https://github.com/cadmiumcr). ## Installation Add this to your application's `shard.yml`: ```yaml dependencies: tourmaline: github: protoncr/tourmaline branch: master ``` ## Usage For usage information please see [the wiki](https://github.com/protoncr/tourmaline/wiki). API documentation is also available [here](https://watzon.github.io/tourmaline/). Examples are available in the [examples](./examples) folder. ## Development This currently supports the following features: - [x] Client API - [x] Implementation examples - [x] Easy command syntax - [x] Robust middleware system - [x] Standard API queries - [x] Stickers - [x] Inline mode - [x] Long polling - [x] Webhooks - [x] Payments - [x] Games - [x] Polls - [ ] Telegram Passport If you want a new feature feel free to submit an issue or open a pull request. ## Who's Using Tourmaline If you're using Tourmaline and would like to have your bot added to this list, just submit a PR! - [fckeverywordbot](https://t.me/fckeverywordbot) - [PixieImageBot](https://t.me/pixieimagebot) ## Contributing 1. Fork it ( https://github.com/protoncr/tourmaline/fork ) 2. Create your feature branch (git checkout -b my-new-feature) 3. Commit your changes (git commit -am 'Add some feature') 4. Push to the branch (git push origin my-new-feature) 5. Create a new Pull Request ## Contributors - [watzon](https://github.com/watzon) Chris Watson - creator, maintainer

types.name: Tourmaline
types.doc:
Tourmaline handler for Kemal.

This handler allows you to use Tourmaline as a part of your
Kemal server rather than as a standalone server. This means
that webhook requests can be sent to a specific path
and handled accordingly.
types.summary: Tourmaline handler for Kemal.

types.name: Chat
types.doc: # This object represents a Telegram user or bot.
types.summary: This object represents a Telegram user or bot.

def.name: from_rs
def.body:
begin
  objs = Array(self).new
  rs.each do
    objs << (self.new(rs))
  end
  objs
ensure
  rs.close
end

def.name: new
def.body:
instance = allocate
instance.initialize(__set_for_db_serializable: rs)
if instance.responds_to?(:finalize)
  GC.add_finalizer(instance)
end
instance

types.name: ChatAction
types.doc:
Chat actions are what appear at the top of the screen
when users are typing, sending files, etc. You can
mimic these actions by using the
`Client#send_chat_action` method.
types.summary: Chat actions are what appear at the top of the screen when users are typing, sending files, etc.

instance_methods.name: to_s
instance_methods.doc:
Returns a `String` representation of this enum member.
In the case of regular enums, this is just the name of the member.
In the case of flag enums, it's the names joined by vertical bars, or "None",
if the value is zero.

If an enum's value doesn't match a member's value, the raw value
is returned as a string.

```
Color::Red.to_s                     # => "Red"
IOMode::None.to_s                   # => "None"
(IOMode::Read | IOMode::Write).to_s # => "Read | Write"

Color.new(10).to_s # => "10"
```
instance_methods.summary: Returns a String representation of this enum member.

def.name: from_user
def.body:
uid = user.is_a?(User) ? user.id : user
Container.get_chat_member(id, uid)

def.name: chat_id
def.body:
if (value = @chat_id).nil?
  ::raise(NilAssertionError.new("Tourmaline::ChatMember#chat_id cannot be nil"))
else
  value
end

def.name: restrict
def.body:
case permissions
when true
  Container.client.restrict_chat_member(chat_id, user.id, {can_send_messages: true, can_send_media_messages: true, can_send_polls: true, can_send_other_messages: true, can_add_web_page_previews: true, can_change_info: true, can_invite_users: true, can_pin_messages: true}, until_date)
when false
  Container.client.restrict_chat_member(chat_id, user.id, {can_send_messages: false, can_send_media_messages: false, can_send_polls: false, can_send_other_messages: false, can_add_web_page_previews: false, can_change_info: false, can_invite_users: false, can_pin_messages: false}, until_date)
else
  Container.client.restrict_chat_member(chat_id, user.id, permissions, until_date)
end

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (can_send_messages = true, can_send_media_messages = true, can_send_polls = true, can_send_other_messages = true, can_add_web_page_previews = true, can_change_info = true, can_invite_users = true, can_pin_messages = true)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(can_send_messages, can_send_media_messages, can_send_polls, can_send_other_messages, can_add_web_page_previews, can_change_info, can_invite_users, can_pin_messages)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

types.name: Client
types.doc:
The `Client` class is the base class for all Tourmaline based bots.
Extend this class to create your own bots, or create an
instance of `Client` and add commands and listenters to it.
types.summary: The Client class is the base class for all Tourmaline based bots.

constructors.name: new
constructors.doc:
Create a new instance of `Tourmaline::Client`. It is
highly recommended to set `@api_key` at an environment
variable.
constructors.args_string: (api_key : String, updates_timeout : Int32? = nil, allowed_updates : Array(String)? = nil, persistence : Persistence = NilPersistence.new)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(api_key, updates_timeout, allowed_updates, persistence)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

instance_methods.name: add_sticker_to_set
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to add a new sticker to a set created by the bot.
Returns `true` on success.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to add a new sticker to a set created by the bot.
instance_methods.args_string: (user_id, name, emojis, png_sticker = nil, tgs_sticker = nil, mask_position = nil)

def.name: add_sticker_to_set
def.body:
if png_sticker || tgs_sticker
else
  raise("A sticker is required, but none was provided")
end
response = request("addStickerToSet", {user_id: user_id, name: name, png_sticker: png_sticker, tgs_sticker: tgs_sticker, emojis: emojis, mask_position: mask_position})
response == "true"

instance_methods.name: answer_callback_query
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to send answers to callback queries sent from
inline keyboards. The answer will be displayed to the user
as a notification at the top of the chat screen or as
an alert. On success, `true` is returned.

> Alternatively, the user can be redirected to the specified
> Game URL (`url`). For this option to work, you must first
> create a game for your bot via @Botfather and accept the
> terms. Otherwise, you may use links like
> [t.me/your_bot?start=XXXX](https://t.me/your_bot?start=XXXX)
> that open your bot with a parameter.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to send answers to callback queries sent from inline keyboards.
instance_methods.args_string: (callback_query_id, text = nil, show_alert = nil, url = nil, cache_time = nil)

def.name: answer_callback_query
def.body:
response = request("answerCallbackQuery", {callback_query_id: callback_query_id, text: text, show_alert: show_alert, url: url, cache_time: cache_time})
response == "true"

instance_methods.name: answer_inline_query
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to send answers to an inline query.
On success, True is returned. No more than
**50** results per query are allowed.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to send answers to an inline query.
instance_methods.args_string: (inline_query_id, results, cache_time = nil, is_personal = nil, next_offset = nil, switch_pm_text = nil, switch_pm_parameter = nil)

def.name: answer_inline_query
def.body:
response = request("answerInlineQuery", {inline_query_id: inline_query_id, results: results.to_json, cache_time: cache_time, is_personal: is_personal, next_offset: next_offset, switch_pm_text: switch_pm_text, switch_pm_parameter: switch_pm_parameter})
response == "true"

instance_methods.name: answer_pre_checkout_query
instance_methods.doc:
Once the user has confirmed their payment and shipping details, the Client API sends
the final confirmation in the form of a `Update` with the field pre_checkout_query.
Use this method to respond to such pre-checkout queries.
On success, `true` is returned.

> Note: The Client API must receive an answer within 10 seconds after the
> pre-checkout query was sent.
instance_methods.summary: Once the user has confirmed their payment and shipping details, the Client API sends the final confirmation in the form of a Update with the field pre_checkout_query.

def.name: answer_pre_checkout_query
def.body:
response = request("answerPreCheckoutQuery", {pre_checkout_query_id: pre_checkout_query_id, ok: ok, error_message: error_message})
Bool.from_json(response)

instance_methods.name: answer_shipping_query
instance_methods.doc:
If you sent an invoice requesting a shipping address and the parameter is_flexible
was specified, the Client API will send a `Update` with a shipping_query field to
the bot. Use this method to reply to shipping queries.
On success, `true` is returned.
instance_methods.summary: If you sent an invoice requesting a shipping address and the parameter is_flexible was specified, the Client API will send a Update with a shipping_query field to the bot.

def.name: answer_shipping_query
def.body:
response = request("answerShippingQuery", {shipping_query_id: shipping_query_id, ok: ok, shipping_options: shipping_options, error_message: error_message})
Bool.from_json(response)

instance_methods.name: bot_name
instance_methods.doc:
Gets the name of the Client at the time the Client was
started. Refreshing can be done by setting
`@bot_name` to `get_me.username.to_s`.
instance_methods.summary: Gets the name of the Client at the time the Client was started.

instance_methods.name: create_new_sticker_set
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to create new sticker set owned by a user. The bot will be able to
edit the created sticker set. You must use exactly one of the fields `png_sticker` or `tgs_sticker`.
Returns `true` on success.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to create new sticker set owned by a user.
instance_methods.args_string: (user_id, name, title, emojis, png_sticker = nil, tgs_sticker = nil, contains_masks = nil, mask_position = nil)

def.name: create_new_sticker_set
def.body:
if png_sticker || tgs_sticker
else
  raise("A sticker is required, but none was provided")
end
response = request("createNewStickerSet", {user_id: user_id, name: name, title: title, png_sticker: png_sticker, tgs_sticker: tgs_sticker, emojis: emojis, contains_masks: contains_masks, mask_position: mask_position})
response == "true"

instance_methods.name: delete_chat_photo
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to delete a chat photo. Photos can't be changed for private chats.
The bot must be an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the
appropriate admin rights.
Returns `true` on success.

> **Note:** In regular groups (non-supergroups), this method will only work if the
`All Members Are Admins` setting is off in the target group.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to delete a chat photo.

def.name: delete_chat_photo
def.body:
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int) ? chat : chat.id
response = request("deleteChatPhoto", {chat_id: chat_id})
response == "true"

instance_methods.name: delete_chat_sticker_set
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to delete a group sticker set from a supergroup. The bot must be
an administrator in the chat for this to work and must have the appropriate
admin rights. Use the field can_set_sticker_set optionally returned in
`#get_chat` requests to check if the bot can use this method.
Returns `true` on success.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to delete a group sticker set from a supergroup.

instance_methods.name: delete_message
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to delete a `Message`, including service messages,
with the following limitations:
- A message can only be deleted if it was sent less than 48 hours ago.
- Bots can delete outgoing messages in private chats, groups, and supergroups.
- Bots can delete incoming messages in private chats.
- Bots granted can_post_messages permissions can delete outgoing messages in channels.
- If the bot is an administrator of a group, it can delete any message there.
- If the bot has `can_delete_messages` permission in a supergroup or a
  channel, it can delete any message there.
Returns `true` on success.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to delete a Message, including service messages, with the following limitations: - A message can only be deleted if it was sent less than 48 hours ago.

def.name: delete_message
def.body:
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int) ? chat : chat.id
message_id = message.is_a?(Int32 | Int64 | Nil) ? message : message.id
response = request("deleteMessage", {chat_id: chat_id, message_id: message_id})
response == "true"

instance_methods.name: delete_sticker_from_set
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to delete a sticker from a set created by the bot.
Returns `true` on success.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to delete a sticker from a set created by the bot.

instance_methods.name: delete_webhook
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to remove webhook integration if you decide to switch
back to getUpdates.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to remove webhook integration if you decide to switch back to getUpdates.

instance_methods.name: edit_message_caption
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to edit captions of messages. On success,
if edited message is sent by the bot, the edited
`Message` is returned, otherwise `true`
is returned.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to edit captions of messages.
instance_methods.args_string: (chat, caption, message = nil, inline_message = nil, parse_mode = ParseMode::Normal, reply_markup = nil)

def.name: edit_message_caption
def.body:
if (!message) && (!inline_message)
  raise("A message_id or inline_message_id is required")
end
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int) ? chat : chat.id
message_id = message.is_a?(Int32 | Int64 | Nil) ? message : message.id
inline_message_id = inline_message.is_a?(Int32 | Int64 | Nil) ? inline_message : inline_message.id
parse_mode = parse_mode == ParseMode::Normal ? nil : parse_mode.to_s
response = request("editMesasageCaption", {chat_id: chat_id, caption: caption, message_id: message_id, inline_message_id: inline_message_id, parse_mode: parse_mode, reply_markup: reply_markup ? reply_markup.to_json : nil})
response.is_a?(String) ? response == "true" : Message.from_json(response)

instance_methods.name: edit_message_live_location
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to edit live location messages. A location can be edited until
its live_period expires or editing is explicitly disabled by a call to
`#stopMessageLiveLocation`.
On success, if the edited message wasn't by the bot, the edited `Message` is
returned, otherwise `true` is returned.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to edit live location messages.
instance_methods.args_string: (chat, latitude, longitude, message = nil, inline_message = nil, reply_markup = nil)

def.name: edit_message_live_location
def.body:
if (!message) && (!inline_message)
  raise("A message_id or inline_message_id is required")
end
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int) ? chat : chat.id
message_id = message.is_a?(Int32 | Int64 | Nil) ? message : message.id
inline_message_id = inline_message.is_a?(Int32 | Int64 | Nil) ? inline_message : inline_message.id
response = request("editMessageLiveLocation", {chat_id: chat_id, latitude: latitude, longitude: longitude, message_id: message_id, inline_message_id: inline_message_id, reply_markup: reply_markup ? reply_markup.to_json : nil})
if (message == "true") || (message == "false")
  return message == "true"
end
Message.from_json(response)

instance_methods.name: edit_message_media
instance_methods.args_string: (chat, media, message = nil, inline_message = nil, reply_markup = nil)

def.name: edit_message_media
def.body:
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int) ? chat : chat.id
media = check_open_local_file(media)
message_id = message.is_a?(Int32 | Int64 | Nil) ? message : message.id
inline_message_id = inline_message.is_a?(Int32 | Int64 | Nil) ? inline_message : inline_message.id
if (!message_id) && (!inline_message_id)
  raise("Either a message or inline_message is required")
end
response = request("editMessageMedia", {chat_id: chat_id, media: media, message_id: message_id, inline_message_id: inline_message_id, reply_markup: reply_markup})
Message.from_json(response)

instance_methods.name: edit_message_reply_markup
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to edit only the reply markup of messages.
On success, if edited message is sent by the bot, the
edited `Message` is returned, otherwise `true` is
returned.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to edit only the reply markup of messages.
instance_methods.args_string: (chat, message = nil, inline_message = nil, reply_markup = nil)

def.name: edit_message_reply_markup
def.body:
if (!message) && (!inline_message)
  raise("A message_id or inline_message_id is required")
end
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int) ? chat : chat.id
message_id = message.is_a?(Int32 | Int64 | Nil) ? message : message.id
inline_message_id = inline_message.is_a?(Int32 | Int64 | Nil) ? inline_message : inline_message.id
response = request("editMesasageReplyMarkup", {chat_id: chat_id, message_id: message_id, inline_message_id: inline_message_id, reply_markup: reply_markup ? reply_markup.to_json : nil})
response.is_a?(String) ? response == "true" : Message.from_json(response)

instance_methods.name: edit_message_text
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to edit text and game messages. On success, if
edited message is sent by the bot, the edited `Message`
is returned, otherwise `true` is returned.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to edit text and game messages.
instance_methods.args_string: (chat, text, message = nil, inline_message = nil, parse_mode = ParseMode::Normal, disable_link_preview = false, reply_markup = nil)

def.name: edit_message_text
def.body:
if (!message) && (!inline_message)
  raise("A message_id or inline_message_id is required")
end
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int) ? chat : chat.id
message_id = message.is_a?(Int32 | Int64 | Nil) ? message : message.id
inline_message_id = inline_message.is_a?(Int32 | Int64 | Nil) ? inline_message : inline_message.id
parse_mode = parse_mode == ParseMode::Normal ? nil : parse_mode.to_s
response = request("editMessageText", {chat_id: chat_id, message_id: message_id, inline_message_id: inline_message_id, text: text, parse_mode: parse_mode, disable_web_page_preview: disable_link_preview, reply_markup: reply_markup ? reply_markup.to_json : nil})
Message.from_json(response)

instance_methods.name: export_chat_invite_link
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to generate a new invite link for a chat; any previously
generated link is revoked. The bot must be an administrator in the chat
for this to work and must have the appropriate admin rights.
Returns the new invite link as `String` on success.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to generate a new invite link for a chat; any previously generated link is revoked.

def.name: export_chat_invite_link
def.body:
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int) ? chat : chat.id
response = request("exportChatInviteLink", {chat_id: chat_id})
response.to_s

instance_methods.name: forward_message
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to forward messages of any kind. On success,
the sent `Message` is returned.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to forward messages of any kind.

def.name: forward_message
def.body:
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int) ? chat : chat.id
message_id = message.is_a?(Int) ? message : message.id
from_chat_id = from_chat.is_a?(Int) ? from_chat : from_chat.id
response = request("forwardMessage", {chat_id: chat_id, from_chat_id: from_chat_id, message_id: message_id, disable_notification: disable_notification})
Message.from_json(response)

instance_methods.name: get_chat
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to get up to date information about the chat
(current name of the user for one-on-one conversations,
current username of a user, group or channel, etc.).
Returns a `Chat` object on success.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to get up to date information about the chat (current name of the user for one-on-one conversations, current username of a user, group or channel, etc.).

def.name: get_chat
def.body:
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int) ? chat : chat.id
response = request("getChat", {chat_id: chat_id})
Chat.from_json(response)

instance_methods.name: get_chat_administrators
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to get a list of administrators in a chat. On success,
returns an `Array` of `ChatMember` objects that contains information
about all chat administrators except other bots. If the chat is a
group or a supergroup and no administrators were appointed,
only the creator will be returned.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to get a list of administrators in a chat.

def.name: get_chat_administrators
def.body:
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int) ? chat : chat.id
response = request("getChatAdministrators", {chat_id: chat_id})
Array(ChatMember).from_json(response)

instance_methods.name: get_chat_member
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to get information about a member of a chat. Returns a
`ChatMember` object on success.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to get information about a member of a chat.

def.name: get_chat_member
def.body:
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int) ? chat : chat.id
user_id = user.is_a?(Int) ? user : user.id
response = request("getChatMember", {chat_id: chat_id, user_id: user_id})
chat_member = ChatMember.from_json(response)
chat_member.chat_id = chat_id
chat_member

instance_methods.name: get_chat_members_count
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to get the number of members in a chat.
Returns `Int32` on success.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to get the number of members in a chat.

def.name: get_chat_members_count
def.body:
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int) ? chat : chat.id
response = request("getChatMembersCount", {chat_id: chat_id})
response.to_i32

instance_methods.name: get_file
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to get basic info about a file and prepare it for downloading.
For the moment, bots can download files of up to **20MB** in size. On success,
a `TFile` object is returned. The file can then be downloaded via the
link `https://api.telegram.org/file/bot<token>/<file_path>`, where
`<file_path>` is taken from the response. It is guaranteed that
the link will be valid for at least 1 hour. When the link
expires, a new one can be requested by calling `#get_file` again.

To simplify retrieving a link for a file, use the `#get_file_link` method.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to get basic info about a file and prepare it for downloading.

instance_methods.name: get_file_link
instance_methods.doc: Returns a download link for a `TFile`.
instance_methods.summary: Returns a download link for a TFile.

instance_methods.name: get_game_high_scores
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to get data for high score tables. Will return the score of the
specified user and several of his neighbors in a game.
On success, returns an `Array` of `GameHighScore` objects.

> This method will currently return scores for the target user, plus two of his
> closest neighbors on each side. Will also return the top three users if the
> user and his neighbors are not among them. Please note that this behavior
> is subject to change.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to get data for high score tables.
instance_methods.args_string: (user_id, chat_id = nil, message_id = nil, inline_message_id = nil)

def.name: get_game_high_scores
def.body:
response = request("getGameHighScores", {user_id: user_id, chat_id: chat_id, message_id: message_id, inline_message_id: inline_message_id})
Array(GameHighScore).from_json(response)

instance_methods.name: get_me
instance_methods.doc:
A simple method for testing your bot's auth token. Requires
no parameters. Returns basic information about the bot
in form of a `User` object.
instance_methods.summary: A simple method for testing your bot's auth token.

instance_methods.name: get_my_commands
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to get the current list of the bot's commands. Requires no parameters.
Returns Array of BotCommand on success.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to get the current list of the bot's commands.

instance_methods.name: get_sticker_set
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to get a sticker set.
On success, a `StickerSet` object is returned.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to get a sticker set.

instance_methods.name: get_updates
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to receive incoming updates using long polling
([wiki](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Push_technology#Long_polling)).
An `Array` of `Update` objects is returned.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to receive incoming updates using long polling (wiki).

def.name: get_updates
def.body:
response = request("getUpdates", {offset: offset, limit: limit, timeout: timeout, allowed_updates: allowed_updates})
updates = Array(Update).from_json(response)
if !updates.empty?
  @next_offset = updates.last.update_id + 1
end
updates

instance_methods.name: get_user_profile_photos
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to get a list of profile pictures for a user.
Returns a `UserProfilePhotos` object.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to get a list of profile pictures for a user.

def.name: get_user_profile_photos
def.body:

end

instance_methods.name: kick_chat_member
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to kick a user from a group, a supergroup or a channel.
In the case of supergroups and channels, the user will not be able to
return to the group on their own using invite links, etc., unless
unbanned first. The bot must be an administrator in the chat
for this to work and must have the appropriate admin
rights. Returns `true` on success.

> Note: In regular groups (non-supergroups), this method will only work
> if the `All Members Are Admins` setting is off in the target group.
> Otherwise members may only be removed by the group's creator or
> by the member that added them.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to kick a user from a group, a supergroup or a channel.

def.name: kick_chat_member
def.body:
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int) ? chat : chat.id
user_id = user.is_a?(Int) ? user : user.id
if (until_date.is_a?(Int) || until_date.nil?)
else
  until_date = until_date.to_unix
end
response = request("kickChatMember", {chat_id: chat_id, user_id: user_id, until_date: until_date})
response == "true"

instance_methods.name: poll
instance_methods.doc:
Start polling for updates. This method uses a combination of `#get_updates`
and `#handle_update` to send continuously check Telegram's servers
for updates.
instance_methods.summary: Start polling for updates.

def.name: poll
def.body:
unset_webhook
@polling = true
Log.info do
  "Polling for updates"
end
while @polling
  begin
    updates = get_updates
    updates.each do |u|
      handle_update(u)
    end
  rescue exception
    Log.error do
      exception.message.to_s
    end
  end
end

instance_methods.name: send_chat_action
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method when you need to tell the user that something is happening on the
bot's side. The status is set for 5 seconds or less (when a message arrives
from your bot, Telegram clients clear its typing status).
Returns `true` on success.

> Example: The ImageBot needs some time to process a request and upload the image.
> Instead of sending a text message along the lines of Retrieving image, please
> wait, the bot may use `#sendChatAction` with action = upload_photo. The user
> will see a sending photo status for the bot.

We only recommend using this method when a response from the bot will take a
noticeable amount of time to arrive.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method when you need to tell the user that something is happening on the bot's side.

def.body:

instance_methods.name: send_poll
instance_methods.doc:
Use this method to send a native poll.
On success, the sent Message is returned.
instance_methods.summary: Use this method to send a native poll.
instance_methods.args_string: (chat, question : String, options : Array(String), anonymous : Bool = true, type : PollType = PollType::Regular, allows_multiple_answers : Bool = false, correct_option_id : Int32? = nil, closed : Bool = false, disable_notification : Bool = false, reply_to_message = nil, reply_markup = nil)

def.name: send_poll
def.body:
if options.size < 2 || options.size > 10
  raise("Incorrect option count. Expected 2-10, given #{options.size}.")
end
if options.any? do |o|
  o.size < 1 || o.size > 100
end
  raise("Incorrect option size. Poll options must be between 1 and 100 characters.")
end
if (type == PollType::Quiz) && (!correct_option_id)
  raise("Quiz poll type requires a correct_option_id be set.")
end
chat_id = chat.is_a?(Int) ? chat : chat.id
if reply_to_message
  reply_to_message = reply_to_message.is_a?(Int) ? reply_to_message : reply_to_message.id
end
response = request("sendPoll", {chat_id: chat_id, question: question, options: options, anonymous: anonymous, type: type.to_s, allows_multiple_answers: allows_multiple_answers, correct_option_id: correct_option_id, is_closed: closed, disable_notification: disable_notification, reply_to_message_id: reply_to_message, reply_markup: reply_markup})
Message.from_json(response)

instance_methods.name: serve
instance_methods.doc:
Start an HTTP server at the specified `address` and `port` that listens for
updates using Telegram's webhooks. This is the reccommended way to handle
bots in production.
instance_methods.summary: Start an HTTP server at the specified address and port that listens for updates using Telegram's webhooks.
instance_methods.args_string: (address = "127.0.0.1", port = 8080, ssl_certificate_path = nil, ssl_key_path = nil)

def.name: serve
def.body:
server = HTTP::Server.new do |context|
  begin
    Fiber.current.telegram_bot_server_http_context = context
    handle_update(Update.from_json(context.request.body.not_nil!))
  rescue exception
    Log.error do
      exception.message.to_s
    end
  ensure
    Fiber.current.telegram_bot_server_http_context = nil
  end
end
server.bind_tcp(address, port)
server.listen
if ssl_certificate_path && ssl_key_path
  fl_use_ssl = true
  ssl = OpenSSL::SSL::Context::Server.new
  ssl.certificate_chain = ssl_certificate_path.not_nil!
  ssl.private_key = ssl_key_path.not_nil!
  server.bind_tls(address, port, ssl)
else
  server.bind_tcp(address, port)
end
Log.info do
  "Listening for Telegram requests at #{address}:#{port}#{if fl_use_ssl
    " with tls"
  end}"
end
server.listen

types.name: Command
types.doc:
Define a new Command. By default all commands start with a `/` and
commands are accessable to all chat types. You can change these
defaults by supplying named parameters to the annotation.

Options:

- `prefix` - the prefix for this command. defaults to `/`.
- `anywhere` - if true, this command will be parsed anywhere inside of a message, not just at the beginning. defaults to `false`.
- `remove_leading` - if true the `text` value passed to the command context will not include the command, if the command is at the beginning. defaults to `true`.
- `private_only` - if true this command will only be allowed inside of private chats.
- `group_only` - if true this command will only be allowed inside of groups.

Example:

```crystal
@[Command("help", prefix: "!", private_only: true)]
def help_command(message, params)
  send_message(message.chat.id, "This is a help message")
end
```

The command can be a string or an array of strings.
types.summary: Define a new Command.

types.name: CommandFilter
types.doc:
Filters messages that include a specific command or commands.

Options:
- `commands : String | Array(String)` - the command(s) to match (without the prefix)
- `prefix : String` - the prefix that should preceed the command(s)
- `private_only : Bool` - if true, command(s) will only be available in private chats
- `group_only : Bool` - if true, command(s) will only be available in group chats
- `admin_only : Bool` if true, command(s) will only work for group admins

Context additions:
- `command : String` - the matched command
- `text : String` - the raw text without the command

Example:
```crystal
filter = CommandFilter.new("echo")
```
types.summary: Filters messages that include a specific command or commands.

constructors.name: new
constructors.args_string: (commands : String | Array(String), prefix = nil, private_only = false, group_only = false, admin_only = false)

def.name: new
def.body:
_ = allocate
_.initialize(commands, prefix, private_only, group_only, admin_only)
if _.responds_to?(:finalize)
  ::GC.add_finalizer(_)
end
_

def.name: exec
def.body:
if message = update.message
  if (text = message.text) || (text = message.caption)
    if private_only && (message.chat.type != "private")
      return false
    end
    if group_only && (message.chat == "private")
      return false
    end
    if @admin_only
      if from = message.from
        admins = client.get_chat_administrators(message.chat.id)
        ids = admins.map do |__arg0|
          __arg0.user.id
        end
        if ids.includes?(from.id)
        else
          return false
        end
      end
    end
    tokens = text.split(/\s+/, 2)
    if tokens.empty?
      return false
    end
    command = tokens[0]
    text = tokens[1]? || ""
    if command.includes?("@")
      command, botname = command.split("@", 2)
      if botname == client.bot_name
      else
        return false
      end
    end
    if command.starts_with?(@prefix)
    else
      return false
    end
    command = command.sub(/^#{@prefix}/, "")
    if @commands.includes?(command)
    else
      return false
    end
    update.set_context({command: command, text: text})
    return true
  end
end
false

def.name: handle_update
exec
def.body:
if @expressions.empty?
  return true
end
if @expressions.size == 1
  return @expressions[0][1].exec(client, update)
end
last = nil
@expressions.each do |__arg0|
  t = __arg0[0]
  f = __arg0[1]
  case t
  when :base
    last = f
  when :or
    if last.try(&.exec(client, update)) || (f.exec(client, update))
    else
      return false
    end
  when :and
    if last.try(&.exec(client, update)) && (f.exec(client, update))
    else
      return false
    end
  else
  end
end
true

types.name: Hears
types.doc:
Similar to `Command`, `Hears` is a more general pattern matcher.
Any time a message matches a pattern defined inside of a
`Hears` annotation the annotated method will be fired.

Example:

```crystal
@[Hears(/^Hello/)]
def respond_to_hello(message)
  send_message(message.chat.id, "Hello to you", respond_to_message: message.message_id)
end

The pattern can be a string, regex, or an array of string/regex.
types.summary: Similar to Command, Hears is a more general pattern matcher.

Create a new instance of `TourmalineHandler`

Requires a `bot` instance, a `url`, and an optional `path`.
The `url` needs to be the publically accessable URL for the
Kemal server. The `path` defines where this will be served on your
kemal instance. By default this is at `/webhook/{bot_name}`, but
it is recommended to use your bot's API key somewhere in the
path for security reasons.

check_config

else

["10.", "172.", "192.", "100."].each do |ippart|

def.name: build_keyboard
def.body:
if columns < 2
  return buttons.map do |b|
    [b]
  end
end
result = [] of Array(T)
current_row = [] of T
wrap_fn = wrap ? wrap : ->(btn : T, index : Int32, current_row : Array(T)) do
  current_row.size >= columns
end
buttons.each_with_index do |btn, index|
  if (  (wrap_fn.call(btn, index, current_row)) && current_row.size > 0)
    result << current_row
    current_row.clear
  end
  current_row << btn
end
if current_row.size > 0
  result << current_row
end
result

def.name: format_html
def.body:
available = entities.dup opened = [] of MessageEntity result = [] of String | Char text.chars.each_index do |i| loop do index = available.index do |e| e.offset == i end if index.nil? break end entity = available[index] case entity.type when "bold" result << "" when "italic" result << "" when "code" result << "" when "pre" if entity.language result << "
"
      else
        result << "
"
      end
    when "strikethrough"
      result << ""
    when "underline"
      result << ""
    when "text_mention"
      if user = entity.user
        result << ""
      end
    when "text_link"
      result << ""
    end
    opened.unshift(entity)
    available.delete_at(index)
  end
  result << text[i]
  loop do
    index = opened.index do |e|
      ((e.offset + e.length) - 1) == i
    end
    if index.nil?
      break
    end
    entity = opened[index]
    case entity.type
    when "bold"
      result << ""
    when "italic"
      result << ""
    when "code"
      result << ""
    when "pre"
      result << "
"
    when "strikethrough"
      result << ""
    when "underline"
      result << ""
    when "text_mention"
      if user = entity.user
        result << ""
      end
    when "text_link"
      result << ""
    end
    opened.delete_at(index)
  end
end
result.join("")

types.name: LocaleFilter
types.doc:
Filters messages not from users with a specific language_code. Keep in mind
that not all Users have a language_code.

Options:
- `locale : String | Regex` - the language code/pattern to match on

Context additions:
- `language_code : String` - the matched language code

Example:
```crystal
filter = LocaleFilter.new(/en|es/)
```
types.summary: Filters messages not from users with a specific language_code.

def.name: exec
def.body:
result = false
update.users do |user|
  if (language_code = user.language_code) && (language_code.match(@locale))
    update.set_context({language_code: language_code})
    result = true
  end
end
result

constants.name: Formatter
constants.value:
->(entry : ::Log::Entry, io : IO) do
  severity = entry.severity
  level = ("[" + ("%-7s" % severity.to_s)) + "]"
  source = ("[" + ("%-10s" % entry.source)) + "]"
  io << (color_message("#{level} #{source} - #{entry.message}", severity))
end

types.name: On
types.doc:
Run the annotated method every time a particular `UpdateAction`
is fired.

Example:

```crystal
@[On(:message)]
def on_message(message)
  pp message
end
```

types.name: OnCallbackQuery
types.doc:
Run the annotated method when a matching callback_query is found, passing
in a `Context` object.

Example:

```crystal
@[OnCallbackQuery("button_click")]
def on_button_click(ctx)
  pp ctx.update_action
end
```
types.summary: Run the annotated method when a matching callback_query is found, passing in a Context object.

instance_methods.name: to_s
instance_methods.doc:
Returns a `String` representation of this enum member.
In the case of regular enums, this is just the name of the member.
In the case of flag enums, it's the names joined by vertical bars, or "None",
if the value is zero.

If an enum's value doesn't match a member's value, the raw value
is returned as a string.

```
Color::Red.to_s                     # => "Red"
IOMode::None.to_s                   # => "None"
(IOMode::Read | IOMode::Write).to_s # => "Read | Write"

Color.new(10).to_s # => "10"
```
instance_methods.summary: Returns a String representation of this enum member.

types.name: RegexFilter
types.doc:
Filters messages with text (`message.text` | `message.caption`) using a
regular expression.

Options:
- `expressions : *Regex` - regular expressions to match on

Context additions:
- `match : Regex::MatchData` - the match data returned by the successful match

Example:
```crystal
filter = RegexFilter.new(/^foo(\d+)/)
```
types.summary: Filters messages with text (message.text | message.caption) using a regular expression.

def.name: exec
def.body:
if message = update.message
  if (text = message.text) || (text = message.caption)
    @expressions.each do |re|
      if match = re.match(message.text.to_s)
        update.set_context({match: match})
        return true
      end
    end
  end
end
false

instance_methods.name: update_id
instance_methods.doc:
The updates unique identifier. Update identifiers start from a certain
positive number and increase sequentially. This ID becomes especially
handy if youre using Webhooks, since it allows you to ignore
repeated updates or to restore the correct update sequence,
should they get out of order. If there are no new updates
for at least a week, then identifier of the next update
will be chosen randomly instead of sequentially.
instance_methods.summary: The updates unique identifier.

instance_methods.name: users
instance_methods.doc: Returns all users included in this update as a Set
instance_methods.summary: Returns all users included in this update as a Set

def.name: users
def.body:
users = [] of User | ::Nil
[self.channel_post, self.edited_channel_post, self.edited_message, self.message].compact.each do |message|
  if message
    users.concat(message.users)
  end
end
if query = self.callback_query
  users << query.from
  if message = query.message
    users.concat(message.users)
  end
end
[self.chosen_inline_result, self.shipping_query, self.inline_query, self.pre_checkout_query].compact.each do |e|
  if e.from
    users << e.from
  end
end
[self.poll_answer].compact.each do |e|
  if e.user
    users << e.user
  end
end
users.compact.uniq!

instance_methods.name: to_s
instance_methods.doc:
Returns a `String` representation of this enum member.
In the case of regular enums, this is just the name of the member.
In the case of flag enums, it's the names joined by vertical bars, or "None",
if the value is zero.

If an enum's value doesn't match a member's value, the raw value
is returned as a string.

```
Color::Red.to_s                     # => "Red"
IOMode::None.to_s                   # => "None"
(IOMode::Read | IOMode::Write).to_s # => "Read | Write"

Color.new(10).to_s # => "10"
```
instance_methods.summary: Returns a String representation of this enum member.

instance_methods.doc:
Assumes the underlying value is an `Array` or `Hash`
and returns the element at the given *index_or_key*.

Raises if the underlying value is not an `Array` nor a `Hash`.
instance_methods.summary: Assumes the underlying value is an Array or Hash and returns the element at the given index_or_key.

def.body:
case object = @raw
when Array
  if index_or_key.is_a?(Int)
    object[index_or_key]
  else
    raise("Expected int key for Array#[], not #{object.class}")
  end
when Hash
  object[index_or_key]
else
  raise("Expected Array or Hash, not #{object.class}")
end

def.name: from_rs
def.body:
begin
  objs = Array(self).new
  rs.each do
    objs << (self.new(rs))
  end
  objs
ensure
  rs.close
end
